skill.name: fiduciary-duty-negligence
skill.description: Clerk for Crown fiduciary breaches, fund mismanagement, conflicts of interest, and failure to protect reserve lands; use for Fiduciary_Duty_Negligence queue.
skill.summary: Clerk for Crown fiduciary breaches, fund mismanagement, conflicts of interest, and failure to protec...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based skill containing only agent instructions for document analysis. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access patterns are included. The skill provides workflow guidance for a clerk role processing legal documents.

content.value_statement: Legal researchers need to systematically review and index historical records of Crown fiduciary breaches. This skill provides a clerk workflow to extract verbatim evidence from documents while maintaining legal-grade standards and neutrality.
actual_capabilities: Process Fiduciary_Duty_Negligence queue tasks in batches
Read and analyze JSON task files with historical document references
Extract verbatim evidence with proper page anchoring and provenance
Draft structured JSON analysis with metadata and forensic conclusions
Flag corrupt, irrelevant, or OCR-failed documents for follow-up
Apply context refresh protocol to prevent hallucination
limitations: Does not execute Python scripts or external commands
Does not access external filesystems beyond the skill directory
Does not make network calls or connect to external services
Does not access environment variables or system credentials
Does not automate analysis - requires manual reading of document content

use_cases.title: Historical breach analysis
use_cases.description: Review Indigenous land claims documents for Crown fiduciary negligence evidence following legal-grade protocols.

use_cases.title: Document classification
use_cases.description: Classify and index historical records by relevance to fiduciary duty cases with proper provenance tracking.

use_cases.title: Evidence compilation
use_cases.description: Compile verified evidence from scattered documents into structured JSON format for legal proceedings.

prompt_templates.title: Get new task batch
prompt_templates.prompt: Process the Fiduciary_Duty_Negligence queue. Get a batch of tasks, read each JSON task file, and analyze the document references for evidence of fund mismanagement, conflicts of interest, or failure to protect reserve lands.

prompt_templates.title: Apply verbatim protocols
prompt_templates.prompt: Read the JSON task file and extract the document content. Apply the Legal-Grade Verbatim Protocol: extract verbatim quotes, verify provenance, check for contradictions, and document the page number for each evidence piece.

prompt_templates.title: Draft analysis output
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an analysis JSON file with the batch ID and results. For each task, include doc_id, title, date, provenance, reliability, ocr_status, relevance, factual summary, forensic context, and key evidence with verbatim quotes.

prompt_templates.title: Submit or flag results
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate the analysis JSON against submission rules: check for forbidden opinion words, ensure metadata integrity, verify date format is YYYY or Undated. Then submit the batch or flag any tasks that are corrupt, irrelevant, or need OCR processing.

output_examples.input: Process a Fiduciary_Duty_Negligence batch and analyze the documents for Crown fiduciary breaches.
output: Sample Evidence: 1913 Letter from O'Reilly to Ditchburn regarding IR10. Document records specific acreage reduction of 20 acres from original 1878 survey.
Key Quote: 'Account 152 shows unexplained deductions not credited to Cook's Ferry Band'
Next Action: Submit batch for ManagerReview

best_practices: Re-read the instruction file after every 5 tasks to prevent context drift and maintain accuracy.
Always use verbatim extraction with page anchoring - never summarize or interpret document content.
Validate all metadata before submission: dates must be YYYY format, doc_id must be present, and no opinion words allowed.
anti_patterns: Using scripts to automatically scan or filter task content - manual reading is required for accurate analysis.
Leaving metadata as 'Unknown' when information exists in the document content.
Using opinion words like 'suggests', 'likely', or 'implies' in summaries or conclusions.

faq.question: Which AI platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It requires JSON file reading capabilities and agent instruction following.

faq.question: How many documents can I process in one batch?
faq.answer: The skill processes Super Tasks containing up to 40,000 characters with 10-15 pages of continuous context per document.

faq.question: Can I automate the analysis with Python scripts?
faq.answer: No. The skill explicitly forbids writing scripts to scan or filter content. Manual reading and judgment are required.

faq.question: Is my data safe when processing these documents?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill operates on local JSON files and produces JSON output. No network calls or external data transmission occurs.

faq.question: What do I do with OCR-failed documents?
faq.answer: Flag the task with reason 'OCR_Failure' using the flag-task command. The source file will automatically move to the Vision Pipeline for reprocessing.

faq.question: How is this different from a general document analyzer?
faq.answer: This skill applies legal-grade verbatim protocols requiring factual-only summaries, strict provenance checks, and banned opinion words enforcement.
